acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours EC50=0.74mg/L of the algae (Chlorella) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report, 2004).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 807mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 807mg/kg, 1,072mg/kg and 907mg/kg (DFGOT vol.6 (1994)).

carcinogenicity.rationale:
No data available
As for the health hazards, refer to "ID413, Dinitrotoluene, CAS: 25321-14-6."

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (BCF<2.7(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data, )), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

explosives.rationale: Because of a lack of data on the kick-off temperature and decomposition energy (though the substance contains nitro groups with its oxygen budget calculated at -114, and may explode if heated according to ICSC (2004)). Classified as Division 6.1 (UN#3454 (solid) and UN#1600 (molten)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as flammable according to ICSC (2004). Classified intoo Division 6.1 (UN#3454 (solid) and UN#1600 (molten)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests, germ/somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo and germ/somatic cell genotoxicity tests in vivo, and no positive data on mutagenicity tests in vitro (several indices), described in NTP DB (Access on April 2006).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: No data available, though being organic compounds containing oxygen bound to elements other than carbon and hydrogen. Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3454 (solid) and 1600 (molten)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3454 (solid) and 1600 (molten)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

reproductive_toxicity.rationale:
No data available
As for the health hazards, refer to "ID413, Dinitrotoluene, CAS: 25321-14-6."

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 58degC (ICSC, 2004), test temperature: 140degC).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing nitro groups with explosive properties. The substance may explode if heated according to ICSC (2004). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3454 (solid) and 1600 (molten)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale:
No data available
As for the health hazards, refer to "ID413, Dinitrotoluene, CAS: 25321-14-6."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale:
No data available.
As for the health hazards, refer to "ID413, Dinitrotoluene, CAS: 25321-14-6."

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the positive results in skin sensitization studies with guinea pigs (Maximization Tests) (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.51 (2004)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 2 (central nervous system, cardiovascular system, blood system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (central nervous system, cardiovascular system, blood system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale:
Based on the human evidence: "adversely affects the central nervous system, cardiovascular system and blood, and may produce methemoglobin" (ICSC (J) (1997)).
Refer to "Dinitrotoluene (ID_0413, CAS_25321-14-6)."

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 2 (central nervous system, cardiovascular system, blood system),
Category 3 (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
May cause damage to organs (central nervous system, cardiovascular system, blood system)
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale:
Based on the human evidence: "adversely affects the central nervous system, cardiovascular system and blood, and may produce methemoglobin" (ICSC (J) (1997)). Also based on the evidence from animal studies including "somnolency " (RTECS (1999)). 
Refer to "Dinitrotoluene (ID_0413, CAS_25321-14-6)."
